title: Ruth Fitzpatrick, who fought to ordain female priests, dies at 90
description: “We will not accept men telling women they can’t be priests because that’s the way God wants it,” Ms. Fitzpatrick once said. “She does not!”

title: Esteban Volkov, Trotsky’s grandson and keeper of his flame, dies at 97
description: He preserved the memory of his grandfather through a museum he started in a suburb of Mexico City, in the home where his grandfather was assassinated.

title: David Calleo, scholar who traced American foreign policy flaws, dies at 88
description: For decades, Dr. Calleo picked apart what he called the U.S. "unipolar fantasy" of a world led by Washington.

title: All killed after missing Titanic sub suffered ‘catastrophic implosion’
description: Five passengers declared dead as search concludes after debris located on ocean floor.

title: Delivering mail in war-ravaged Ukraine: ‘There are still people living here’
description: Three times a month, postal workers risk their lives to bring letters, pensions, medicine and groceries to the few residents left in Hulyaipole, a small city near the front line.

title: CEO touted the Titan as ‘one of the great moments of submersibles’ in 2018
description: “The days of government funding are gone,” OceanGate CEO Stockton Rush said at the Titan's christening in 2018, five years before it went missing.

title: Russian ban of wildlife fund signals isolation even on animal protection
description: Animals were once a soft spot for Vladimir Putin, who took pride in protecting tigers and other species, but the outlawing of the World Wildlife Fund shows war aims and economic interests taking priority.

title: Inquiry after girl’s death shows unsafe medical care in U.S. border facilities
description: An internal Department of Homeland Security memo says medical care in U.S. border facilities is unsafe for migrants and needs a major overhaul.

title: New weapons, tactics further entangle U.S. in Israeli-Palestinian conflict
description: The use of new and more powerful weapons harks back to the all-out war of the second intifada more than 20 years ago.

title: Zelensky says Russia is planning to sabotage Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant
description: The Ukrainian president said that Russia was planning to sabotage Europe's largest atomic power plant and release radiation, weeks after Kyiv blamed Moscow for destroying the Kahkovka dam.

title: Russian court rejects appeal by jailed U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich
description: The Wall Street Journal reporter, imprisoned on espionage charges widely viewed as fabricated, will remain in Lefortovo prison after a court denied an appeal of his detention.

title: Court could ban Brazil’s Bolsonaro from running for office
description: Brazil's former president is accused of undermining confidence in the country's democracy. He is charged with abuse of power.

title: Ukraine live briefing: U.K. backs speeding up Ukraine’s NATO entry; Kyiv expects invite at leaders meeting
description: A Ukrainian official said Kyiv expects an invitation to join NATO, with an “open date,” when the leaders of the military alliance meet at a summit next month.

title: How a once-banned Modi is making history in Washington
description: Modi, then the chief minister of Gujarat state, was denied a visa in 2005 over allegations related to religious mob violence.

title: Barbecue restaurant explosion in China kills 31, injures seven others
description: A gas leak caused a blast at a restaurant in Yinchuan, the capital of the Ningxia region in western China, authorities said.

title: She promised a kids’ party with Pinterest fails. Parents are celebrating it.
description: Carys Roberts quickly wrote an invitation for her 4-year-old twins’ birthday party next month in Ontario. It went viral on TikTok.
